alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 8:18AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Morgan and Scott. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated still moderate to heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen with some area possibly more. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to one inch is possible over the area through 11 AM. This additional rain will result in more minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wartburg, Oliver Springs, Huntsville, Helenwood, Sunbright, Frozen Head State Park, Slick Rock, Petros, Elgin, Robbins, Rosedale, Smokey Junction, Norma, Coalfield, Rugby State Park, Deerlodge, Rugby and High Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
